data.headline: US stock futures retreat as hawkish Fed minutes dampen rate-cut hopes and geopolitical tensions lift oil and gold
bullets: S&P 500, Dow, Nasdaq 100, and Russell 2000 futures all trade lower, reversing yesterdayâ€™s Nvidia-led rally.
Fed minutes signal a divided, hawkish stance, curbing expectations for near-term rate cuts and fueling risk-off sentiment.
Escalating US-Iran tensions push oil to multi-month highs, boosting energy stocks and nudging gold prices higher.
Walmart drops premarket after issuing a disappointing earnings outlook, weighing on the retail sector.
Carvana tumbles on mixed results and higher costs, adding to sector-specific volatility.
Etsy surges nearly 20% premarket after announcing the sale of Depop to eBay.
DoorDash, Deere, and Quanta also post premarket gains on company-specific news.
Traders remain focused on upcoming economic data and Fedspeak, with no major new macro catalysts yet.
